poem:
**A Day in Changes**

Morning light stirs  
their practiced dance:  
politician poised,  
lawyer burnt down to ember,  
facing the ordinary  
with extraordinary grace.  
In dialogue of toast,  
whispers of students and  
shadowed campaigns  
weave their lives,  
married to time's  
quiet demands,  
turning seasons  
of bread and roles,  
roles and bread.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Changes review – secrets, blackmail and lightning fast role-juggling A day in the life of a couple plays out from breakfast to dinner. She is a self-composed politician, he is a burnt-out lawyer turned anxious school teacher. They have been married for 20 years and we meet them in the morning discussing toast, problem students and political campaigns before they set off into their working day. It is ordinary life, given an extraordinary theatrical twist". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
